info.game_comments: Game data retrieved from an alternate archive.

(1, 1).clue: It's the part of the Big Mac that contains sesame seeds

(2, 1).clue: Roger Bacon, the first European with a gunpowder recipe, was educated at this English university

(3, 1).clue: Last name of Mamie, who had a 1920 hit with "Crazy Blues", & also of the better-known Bessie

(4, 1).clue: Its velocity can be thousands of feet per second, so we know Superman's faster than that

(5, 1).clue: He's the boy who had a "terrible, horrible, no good, very bad day"

(6, 1).clue: In the sixth chapter of his book, this prophet stands unafraid between the lions in their den

(1, 2).clue: Sesame paste is used like & substituted for this sandwich spread made from legumes

(2, 2).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew presents from Providence, RI.)  This compass is believed to be the one that guided this man to the place he called Providence in 1636

(3, 2).clue: (Hi, I'm Buddy Guy.)  This cat from Cream who's not a bad blues player himself called me the best guitar player around

(4, 2).clue: Using radar, scientists measured it at over 300 mph in Oklahoma in 1999

(5, 2).clue: "Mr. Toad" & "Mr. Badger" are chapters in this Kenneth Grahame classic

(1, 3).clue: Baba Ghanoush is made with sesame oil & this member of the nightshade family

(2, 3).clue: This king of low-budget moviemaking came to California from Michigan in his teens

(4, 3).clue: A "speedy" part of a river; you can go down them 30 mph at Raging Waters' Neptune's Fury ride

(6, 3).clue: Alex Karras & Barry Sanders both had success playing among their fellow Lions of this city

(6, 4).clue: Nickname shared by France's Louis VIII & England's Richard I

(1, 5).clue: Falafel is often served with this thick paste made primarily from ground sesame seeds

(3, 5).clue: State that preceded the names of bluesmen John Hurt & Fred McDowell

(4, 5).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew presents from Churchill Downs in Louisville, Kentucky) In 1973, this horse ran the Derby in a record 1 minute, 59 and 2/5, for an average speed of 38 miles per hour

(5, 5).clue: E.B. White named the main character in this book after Louis Armstrong

(6, 5).clue: If you're standing between 2 lions at this country's Kruger National Park, let's hope they're not hungry!

(1, 1).clue: This light metal, symbol Li, falls between helium & beryllium on the periodic table
